item.description:
Come join me for an after the holidays..."Ah... moment to relax." This is a great place to eat good food for a reasonable price. Nice environment. Restaurant is located to the rear of the building on the Fitchburg side.

   The online daily menu can be checked on their website...

http://www.montytech.net/

    Just click on "School Restaurant Menu"

 

   Please note: Crampons or snowshoes may be required according to conditions. Please dress warmly in layers and bring an adequate water supply for three hours. Should be an easy to moderate hike.

 

    Here's a link to Hike New England's site containing information about the area I'd like to check out. It is part of the Mid-state Trail just south of Monty Tech in the area of Muddy Pond.

http://www.hikenewengland.com/Watatic000407...

 

Directions to Monty Tech's School Restaurant:

From the North or South - Find your best connection to route 2 and head towards Fitchburg. From the east take exit 28 (at Route 31) north towards Fitchburg. At the intersection of route 2A and route 31 make a very sharp left onto route 2A west towards Westminster.

Monty Tech is on the right hand side at the top of the hill. From the west, take exit 26 and head east on route 2A towards Fitchburg.

Monty Tech is on the left hand side at the Westminster-Fitchburg line. From Worcester, and western Massachusetts via the Mass Pike, take route 290 in Worcester to route 190 North (at the Greendale Mall). Follow route 190 to route 2 West. Take exit 28 (at Route 31) north towards Fitchburg. At the intersection of route 2A and route 31 make a very sharp left onto route 2A West towards Westminster.

Monty Tech is on the right hand side at the top of the hill {An alternate route during non-rush hours that can save some time is to take route 190 to route 140 North (Exit 5). Route 140 joins route 2A in Westminster; just follow route 2A East to Monty Tech at the Westminster-Fitchburg line.}

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Lunch at Monty Tech's School Restaurant & Hike Mid-state Trail to Muddy Pond
